medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Intermittent facial pain developed eight months ago, described as sharp, electrical pain triggered by eating, talking, or touching the moustache, primarily affecting the left side of the face, particularly the maxilla, lips, and lower jaw. This was accompanied by a dull, throbbing pain that has been relatively unremitting since onset. The pain induced weight loss of 6.8 kg (15 lb) due to eating discomfort.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, sleep apnea, and multiple minor facial surgeries including gum surgery and a tonsillectomy.
medical_history.social_history: Worked as an engineer, rarely consumed alcohol, and quit smoking 25 years prior after a 30-pack-year history.
